com.redhat.rhn.common.filediff

Class Trace

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.redhat.rhn.common.filediff.Trace

  • public class Trace
extends java.lang.Object
    A single diff trace through two files. Represents one trace of a linked list of traces.

      • step

        public boolean step(java.lang.String[] oldFile,
           java.lang.String[] newFile)
        Step once in this trace. The power of this algorithm is the fact that different traces are explored in parallel. This method is recursive while it keeps finding matching lines. This is because finding matching lines makes this trace much more possibly optimal. This behaviour is what Myers called the "furthest reaching D-path"
        This step method steps backward through the files. This is for the simple reason that when creating hunks, we want to create them in forward order, but we have to visit the edits backwards from how we diffed them. Two backwards make a forward, two negatives make a positive, and two wrongs make a right.
        Parameters:
        oldFile - The old(first, from) file
        newFile - The new(second, to) file
        Returns:
        whether this step forked. (needed for incrementation by the step controller)

      • createHunks

        public java.util.List<Hunk> createHunks(java.lang.String[] oldFile,
                               java.lang.String[] newFile)
        Since the diff was performed backwards, "popping" the resulting edits from the backwards tree gives them in forward order.
        Parameters:
        oldFile - The old(first, from) file
        newFile - The new(second, to) file
        Returns:
        A list of hunks representing the edit to make oldFile into newFile.
